definition: to strike a severe blow/to crack down/to take strong measures
to beat/to strike/to hit/to break/to type/to mix up/to build/to fight/to fetch/to make/to tie up/to issue/to shoot/to calculate/to play (a game)/since/from

sentences.english: He pledged to crack down on rising crime.
sentences.chinese: 他承诺将严厉打击犯罪上升。
第八，严厉打击走私犯罪活动。

sentences.english: We must crack down on offshore tax havens and money laundering.
sentences.chinese: 我们必须严厉打击海外避税港和洗钱活动。

sentences.english: China to harshly crack down on sex-selective abortion .
sentences.chinese: 中国严厉打击性别选择性流产。

sentences.english: In this regard, Municipal Public Security Bureau decided to launch a line of concentrated, to crack down.
sentences.chinese: 对此，市公安局决定开展集中行一，进行严厉打击。

sentences.english: I call for mass killing of Han promoters.
sentences.chinese: 建议严厉打击皇汉主义，大规模屠杀皇汉分子。

sentences.english: We shall strike hard, without flinching, at terrorists and those who abet them.
sentences.chinese: 我们要毫不退缩地严厉打击恐怖分子及其帮凶。

sentences.english: Cracking down upon the crime of accepting bribes is the popular sentiment.
sentences.chinese: 严厉打击受贿犯罪是人心所向。

sentences.english: Carry out joint law enforcement, and strictly conduct crack-down according to law.
sentences.chinese: 实施联合执法，依法严厉打击。

sentences.english: Enhancing the law enforcement efforts to crack down on tax evasion.
sentences.chinese: 增强执法力度，严厉打击偷漏税行为。

sentences.english: Rectifying the economic order in accordance with the law and severely cracking down on economic crimes.
sentences.chinese: 依法整顿经济秩序，严厉打击经济违法犯罪活动。

definition: to crack down on/to take severe measures against
to investigate and handle (a criminal case)
to bring under control/to regulate/to restore to good condition/(coll.) to fix (a person)/to prepare (a meal etc)
to suppress/to crack down on/to prohibit
to try harder/to redouble one's efforts
to check/to contain/to hold back/to keep within limits/to constrain/to restrain
